posts.name: Florian
posts.cooked:
Hi guys,

i would like to know, what are your most-missed-features in Signal right now?

With this thread I don’t want to complain about the development or the decisions made by the developer! I only want to know, which features are important for other users to make Signal the best of the best!

My top three:

  1. Search text in message/messages/conversation/conversations/chat/chats
  2. Remove users from groups
  3. Full backup with all conversations (Signal and Insecure SMS/MMS), media and groups

So, whats yours?

posts.cooked:
I would say:

  1. Full Backup which can also be restored to a blank Signal installation
  2. Scroll through conversations by selecting year or month
  3. Sending one message to multiple contacts without creating a group, so that every contact writes back in his own thread.

Somewhat similiar to the points listed in your ranking, I’m very much in favor of fixing/improving/completing existing core functionality prior to introducing completely new features. Many of these tend to be rather small things.

Examples for Signal Android:

  • Fixing backup
  • Enhancing vCard functionality, so full vCards can get imported from a Signal message into Android’s address book (unfortunately, currently I have to use a different app for this)
  • Enhancing the rather limited search feature into full-text search
  • Ability to multi-select pictures
  • Multiple attachments (especially pictures) within one single message
  • Visual grouping of each contact’s phone numbers in Signal’s contact list
  • Etc

link_counts.title: More features for more People

posts.cooked:
1. Full backup, I don’t want to loose my message history everytime I get a new device
  2. Administration of groups
  3. Sending multiple pictures

link_counts.title: Contacts refuse to use Signal because it lacks many things

posts.cooked:
I have Android phone.

  1. Back camera in video chat.
  2. Simpler to answer to the call (like display of shadow where movement should be made to answer or where to cancel call). Now default Phone Android app has up/down movement to answer/cancel, Signal uses left/right movement.
  3. No need for the pencil icon on main window. Just integrate address book with recent calls and recent calls on top. For older person this pencil icon is just confusion. Additional step to make a call.
  4. Simpler way to change Signal to SMS message (now it has be clicked Attachment icon, not simple to find out).
  5. Simpler way to start unencrypted call (not all users have cell data, so there are only available on WiFi). Like a long press icon on current encrypted+phone icon. Now click on recent calls avatar is needed - too difficult for older person to remember.
  6. Option to make it possible to automatically start unencrypted call after like e.g. 10 attempts on failing Signal dialing. User is not available on WiFi and cell data turned off or not even having one. Now too complicated for usage by older people. For older person it would be ideally if clicking on one icon and starting Signal call, but if Signal call is not established after few try and miss, then automatically start unencrypted call. One simple button to use.
  7. Make bigger icons to enable speaker etc, phone icon, texting icon etc. Older people have real problem using small icons without glasses.
  8. Make it possible to have only one application for calling Signal call and unencrypted call (like having one application for SMS and Signal texting). So when receiver gets an unencrypted call it can answer from Signal app. Now default Android Phone app is started. For older people this is confusing, two app to use. One for Signal call and another for unencrypted call.
  9. Additional to previous option, make option when caller is calling you using unencrypted call, to press a button to establish back call using Signal instead of unencrypted call. Currently I need to cancel the call and start Signal app and dial using Signal. Little bit too complicated.
  10. Sometimes Dialing takes long time before Calling appears. To drastically reduce Dialing time would be fantastic. In order to get previous point working, this point should be fixed first.
  11. Notification that some Signal text was not delivered for like few hours or similar and maybe an option if SMS should be send instead. Or even make it possible to have some setting to set if message is not delivered like in an hour or similar, that Signal app automatically sends SMS message - I know this is not really secure, but undelivered messages may be bigger problem.

Signal Android:

  1. Full backup including all media (choice) and group relations

  2. Sending multiple elements (pictures/videos) at once, using multi-select from within other apps (Android gallery, file manager etc.)

  3. Full search feature (searching inall conversations as well as in single conversation)

  • (batch forwarding of messages)
  • (batch deleting of media in conversation media overview)

We could start a survey for this

Signal-Android

  1. Fully functional backup
  2. Manual read receipts
  3. Share button for media & files

And btw, you can sort Github issues by their number of reactions (and filter by “feature” label): result
You can also vote for your favorite issues/features by giving their initial post a positive reaction, e.g. .

posts.cooked:
FeuRenard:

Manual read receipts

Would give you a thumps up if the GitHub issue wasn’t locked…

ok - let’s dream a bit for the moment… :)

Signal Android:
apart from fundamental things, which were already mentioned (backup, a sort of group administration and message search) I would really like to see the following implemented:

  • detailed delivery receipts in the group message details (#2115; #2373); I really hope that gets solved with the read receipt feature coming up
  • cached delivery receipts when messaging from Signal Desktop to a group conversation (#4924); (at the moment literally every message from desktop gets displayed with one checkmark on my phone although it has two on every desktop instance and gets delivered to the whole group. Nobody else as bothered as I am?
  • Hyperlink previews (#5724)

Signal Desktop:

  • emoji drawer/picker/panel (#194)
  • message search (#367)
  • Allow timer for disappearing messages to be set before enabling them (#952)

Signal iOS:
although I am not using it, I have a few friends who especially complain about:

  • iOS share sheet integration (#650)
  • Giphy integration like Android

edit: marked implemented features with a

posts.cooked: While I’m not very familiar with Signal iOS, I’ve heard that landscape mode is not possible with Signal. If I were a Signal iOS user, that would be a biggie for me.
Thanks. I also saw that for iOS, but until now could not find it in the Android implementation…

posts.name: Jan
posts.cooked:
Allowing to easily delete attachments:

  • Wishlist: Possibility to delete images in gallery mode (and when opened)
  • Allow removing attachments
  • Allow deleting attachments from media overview

Interestingly, there is already a pull request for this.

This feature is so important for me because it is getting more and more difficult to update Signal on my phone with limited memory. I already had to remove several apps to free up space. Currently I have to go through the cumbersome process of manually deleting attachments one by one to free up space before being able to update apps.

After this a full backup and restore functionality (including media) is my most wanted feature, because I would like to backup before deleting attachments.

posts.cooked:
In no particular order:

  • Voice and video calls on desktop: #1046
  • Group voice and video calls: #6075
  • iOS share sheet integration: #650
  • Text search on Android, iOS and desktop: #1232, #646, #367
  • Fully functional backup/export and import on Android and iOS: #1705, #2542
  • Giphy integration on desktop

Things I’m happy to see are being worked on:

  • Standalone desktop client
  • Optional read receipts: #2535
  • Giphy integration on iOS: #2600
  • Private contact discovery
